intro: Ida uribei, commonly known as the Uribei's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the genus Asclepias, which is part of the milkweed family, Apocynaceae. The plant is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers and milky sap, which is a common feature among milkweeds. Ida uribei typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators, including monarch butterflies.
